audit_tests.name: 1.2.1 Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false
audit_tests.description: Disable anonymous requests to the API server.
audit_tests.remediation:
Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the below parameter.
--anonymous-auth=false
audit_tests.default_value: By default, anonymous access is enabled.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.2 Ensure that the --basic-auth-file argument is not set
audit_tests.remediation: Follow the documentation and configure alternate mechanisms for authentication. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and remove the --basic-auth-file=<filename> parameter.
audit_tests.impact: You will have to configure and use alternate authentication mechanisms such as tokens and certificates. Username and password for basic authentication could no longer be used.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, basic authentication is not set.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.3 Ensure that the --token-auth-file parameter is not set
audit_tests.description: Do not use token based authentication.
audit_tests.remediation: Follow the documentation and configure alternate mechanisms for authentication. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and remove the --token-auth-file=<filename> parameter.
audit_tests.impact: You will have to configure and use alternate authentication mechanisms such as certificates. Static token based authentication could not be used.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, --token-auth-file argument is not set.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.4 Ensure that the --kubelet-https argument is set to true
audit_tests.remediation: Follow the documentation and configure alternate mechanisms for authentication. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and remove the --token-auth-file=<filename> parameter.
audit_tests.impact: You require TLS to be configured on apiserver as well as kubelets.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, kubelet connections are over https.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.5 Ensure that the --kubelet-client-certificate and --kubelet-client-key arguments are set as appropriate
audit_tests.remediation: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and set up the TLS connection between the apiserver and kubelets. Then, edit API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the kubelet client certificate and key parameters as below. --kubelet-client-certificate=<path/to/client-certificate-file> --kubelet-client-key=<path/to/client-key-file>
audit_tests.impact: You require TLS to be configured on apiserver as well as kubelets.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, certificate-based kubelet authentication is not set.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.5 Ensure that the --kubelet-client-certificate and --kubelet-client-key arguments are set as appropriate
audit_tests.remediation: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and set up the TLS connection between the apiserver and kubelets. Then, edit API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the kubelet client certificate and key parameters as below. --kubelet-client-certificate=<path/to/client-certificate-file> --kubelet-client-key=<path/to/client-key-file>
audit_tests.impact: You require TLS to be configured on apiserver as well as kubelets.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, certificate-based kubelet authentication is not set.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.6 Ensure that the --kubelet-certificate-authority argument is set as appropriate
audit_tests.description: Verify kubelet's certificate before establishing connection.
audit_tests.remediation: Follow the Kubernetes documentation and setup the TLS connection between the apiserver and kubelets. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the -- kubelet-certificate-authority parameter to the path to the cert file for the certificate authority. --kubelet-certificate-authority=<ca-string>
audit_tests.impact: You require TLS to be configured on apiserver as well as kubelets.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, --kubelet-certificate-authority argument is not set.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.7 Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
audit_tests.description: Do not always authorize all requests.
audit_tests.remediation:
Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the --authorization-mode parameter to values other than AlwaysAllow. One such example could be as below.
--authorization-mode=RBAC
audit_tests.impact: Only authorized requests will be served.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, AlwaysAllow is not enabled.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.8 Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes Node
audit_tests.description: Restrict kubelet nodes to reading only objects associated with them.
audit_tests.remediation: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the --authorization-mode parameter to a value that includes Node. --authorization-mode=Node,RBAC
audit_tests.default_value: By default, Node authorization is not enabled.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.9 Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes RBAC
audit_tests.description: Turn on Role Based Access Control.
audit_tests.remediation: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the --authorization-mode parameter to a value that includes RBAC, for example:--authorization-mode=Node,RBAC
audit_tests.impact: When RBAC is enabled you will need to ensure that appropriate RBAC settings (including Roles, RoleBindings and ClusterRoleBindings) are configured to allow appropriate access.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, RBAC authorization is not enabled.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.10 Ensure that the admission control plugin EventRateLimit is set
audit_tests.description: Limit the rate at which the API server accepts requests.
audit_tests.remediation:
Follow the Kubernetes documentation and set the desired limits in a configuration file. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml and set the below parameters
 --enable-admission-plugins=...,EventRateLimit,... --admission-control-config-file=<path/to/configuration/file>
audit_tests.impact: You need to carefully tune in limits as per your environment.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, EventRateLimit is not set.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.11 Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysAdmit is not set
audit_tests.remediation: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and either remove the --enable-admission-plugins parameter, or set it to a value that does not include AlwaysAdmit.
audit_tests.impact: Only requests explicitly allowed by the admissions control plugins would be served.
audit_tests.default_value: AlwaysAdmit is not in the list of default admission plugins.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.12 Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysPullImages is set
audit_tests.remediation: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the --enable-admission-plugins parameter to include AlwaysPullImages.--enable-admission-plugins=...,AlwaysPullImages,...
audit_tests.impact: Credentials would be required to pull the private images every time. Also, in trusted environments, this might increases load on network, registry, and decreases speed.This setting could impact offline or isolated clusters, which have images pre-loaded and do not have access to a registry to pull in-use images. This setting is not appropriate for clusters which use this configuration.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, AlwaysPullImages is not set.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.13 Ensure that the admission control plugin SecurityContextDeny is set if PodSecurityPolicy is not used
audit_tests.description: The SecurityContextDeny admission controller can be used to deny pods which make use of some SecurityContext fields which could allow for privilege escalation in the cluster. This should be used where PodSecurityPolicy is not in place within the cluster.
audit_tests.remediation:
Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the --enable-admission-plugins parameter to include SecurityContextDeny, unless PodSecurityPolicy is already in place.
--enable-admission-plugins=...,SecurityContextDeny,...
audit_tests.impact: This admission controller should only be used where Pod Security Policies cannot be used on the cluster, as it can interact poorly with certain Pod Security Policies
audit_tests.default_value: By default, SecurityContextDeny is not set.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.14 Ensure that the admission control plugin ServiceAccount is set
audit_tests.remediation: Follow the documentation and create ServiceAccount objects as per your environment. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and ensure that the --disable-admission-plugins parameter is set to a value that does not include ServiceAccount.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.15 Ensure that the admission control plugin NamespaceLifecycle is set
audit_tests.description: Reject creating objects in a namespace that is undergoing termination.
audit_tests.remediation: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the --disable-admission-plugins parameter to ensure it does not include NamespaceLifecycle.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.16 Ensure that the admission control plugin PodSecurityPolicy is set
audit_tests.description: Reject creating pods that do not match Pod Security Policies.
audit_tests.remediation:
Follow the documentation and create Pod Security Policy objects as per your environment. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the --enable-admission-plugins parameter to a value that includes PodSecurityPolicy:
--enable-admission-plugins=...,PodSecurityPolicy,...
audit_tests.impact: The policy objects must be created and granted before pod creation would be allowed.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, PodSecurityPolicy is not set.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.17 Ensure that the admission control plugin NodeRestriction is set
audit_tests.description: Limit the Node and Pod objects that a kubelet could modify.
audit_tests.remediation:
Follow the Kubernetes documentation and configure NodeRestriction plug-in on kubelets. Then, edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and set the --enable-admission-plugins parameter to a value that includes NodeRestriction.
--enable-admission-plugins=...,NodeRestriction,...
audit_tests.default_value: By default, NodeRestriction is not set.

audit_tests.name: 1.2.18 Ensure that the --insecure-bind-address argument is not set
audit_tests.description: Do not bind the insecure API service.
audit_tests.remediation: Edit the API server pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- apiserver.yaml on the master node and remove the --insecure-bind-address parameter.
audit_tests.impact: Connections to the API server will require valid authentication credentials.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, the insecure bind address is not set.
